com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream

Class ConfigArray

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream.ConfigArray

  • public class ConfigArray
extends Object
    Represents the array of configuration blocks that configures the device. It is composed of an array of ConfigRows, each of which is an array of config Blocks.
    Since:
    2020.2.1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FRAME_OVERHEAD_COUNT_PER_ROW
      The number of extra frames at the end of a configuration row

      • getCRIndicesInConfigRowOrder

        public static int[] getCRIndicesInConfigRowOrder(Device d)
        Returns an array of clock region indices that correspond to the order in which they appear in the contiguous FAR address space. This compensates for Series 7 top and bottom half. For multi-SLR devices, only provides the rows for one SLR.
        Parameters:
        d - The target device
        Returns:
        Clock region indices in the order of their configuration.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getPackets

        public List<Packet> getPackets()
        Creates the list of packets that correspond to the current state of this configuration array.
        Returns:
        Conventional packet list with configuration array applied.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

        Number of config words used in the config array

      • getFrame

        public Frame getFrame(FAR far)
        Gets the frame in SLR0 (or monolithic devices) by default at the frame address register specified.
        Parameters:
        far - The FAR object set to the address being requested
        Returns:
        The frame at the specified address in SLR0 or null otherwise.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getFrame

        public Frame getFrame(FAR far,
                      int slrCfgOrder)
        For multi-SLR devices, the FAR has the same addresses as other, so all config rows must use an offset for the SLR. This gets the frame
        Parameters:
        far - The FAR object set to the address being requested in the context of the SLR
        slrCfgOrder - The frame from which SLR to get. In multi-SLR devices, each SLR has its own context.
        Returns:
        The frame at the FAR location specified and in the SLR specified.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getConfigRow

        public ConfigRow getConfigRow(int blockType,
                              int topBot,
                              int row)
        Gets the configuration row based on blockType (CLB vs. BRAM_CONTENT), top or bottom half (Series 7 devices) and the actual row index.
        Parameters:
        blockType - The integer value of enum BlockType.
        topBot - The Series 7 top bottom flag (Top=0, Bottom=1), by default all other architectures are Top=0
        row - The row index encoded in the frame address (see FAR)
        Returns:
        The configuration row specified.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getConfigRow

        public ConfigRow getConfigRow(int blockType,
                              int topBot,
                              int farRow,
                              int slrCfgOrder)
        Gets the configuration row based on blockType (CLB vs. BRAM_CONTENT), top or bottom half (Series 7 devices, FAR row index and the SLR.
        Parameters:
        blockType - The integer value of enum BlockType.
        topBot - The Series 7 top bottom flag (Top=0, Bottom=1), by default all other architectures are Top=0
        farRow - The row index encoded in the frame address (see FAR)
        slrCfgOrder - Configuration order index of the SLR to get the config row. The FAR does not span multiple SLRs and requires context of the SLR to properly get the global row.
        Returns:
        The configuration row specified.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getConfigBlock

        public Block getConfigBlock(Tile tile)
        Get the configuration block that corresponds to the provided tile. The block type is assumed to be CLB.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile of interest
        Returns:
        The configuration block that corresponds to the provided tile, or null if none could be found.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getConfigBlock

        public Block getConfigBlock(Tile tile,
                            BlockType blockType)
        Gets the configuration block that corresponds to the provided tile and block type.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile of interest
        blockType - Valid block types are CLB and BRAM_CONTENT
        Returns:
        The configuration block that corresponds to the provided tile, or null if none could be found.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • addConfigRow

        public boolean addConfigRow(ConfigRow configRow)
        Adds a config row to the array (at the end of the list)
        Parameters:
        configRow - The new row to add
        Returns:
        True if the operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • updateUserStateBits

        public void updateUserStateBits(Cell... cells)
        Updates the users state bits of the provided cells within this config array. This supports updating user state bits (such as flip-flop INIT, LUTRAM INIT and BRAM INIT). These bits are described using the 'write_bitstream -logic_location_file' command in Vivado. If cells that do not affect state bits are provided to the method, no changes will take place in the ConfigArray.
        Parameters:
        cells - The cell(s) containing the updated state settings, see EDIFPropertyObject
        Since:
        2020.2.1
